  • Reference

Formula for fitting the alternative model

Source: R/zzz_VI_MODEL.R
VI_MODEL-cash-alt_formula.Rd

A formula, will be used to fit the alternative model.

Examples


# Instantiation
x <- rand_uniform()
e <- rand_normal()
test <- vi_model(prm = list(x = x, e = e),
                 prm_type = list(x = "r", e = "r"),
                 formula = y ~ 1 + x + x^2 + e,
                 null_formula = y ~ x,
                 alt_formula = y ~ x + I(x^2))

# A formula with environment equals to `test`
test$alt_formula
#> y ~ x + I(x^2)
#> 
#> ── <VI_MODEL object>
#> y = 1 + x + x^2 + e
#>  - x: <RAND_UNIFORM object>
#>    [a: 0, b: 1]
#>  - e: <RAND_NORMAL object>
#>    [mu: 0, sigma: 1] 

# Use alternative formula in `fit`
test$fit(test$gen(10), test$alt_formula)
#> 
#> Call:
#> stats::lm(formula = y ~ x + I(x^2), data = test$gen(10))
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept)            x       I(x^2)  
#>       1.717       -2.034        2.539  
#> 

# F-test also needs to use the alternative model
test$test(test$gen(1000))
#> $name
#> [1] "F-test"
#> 
#> $statistic
#> [1] 5.295341
#> 
#> $p_value
#> [1] 0.02158809
#>
